dlgPart.npc_text: “Well, if it isn’t the unreliable <master/mistress> <charname>. I’d love to chat but I have a guild to run. Now that the city is under new management, as they say, we can expand our operations and secure previously unattainable positions.”

“Are you asking if I managed to land on my feet after you betrayed me and handed the city over to Maseus? Of course I did. Strabos needs money to secure his gains, which means he needs me working my magic and conjuring gold out of thin air.
“Needless to say, you’re no longer in my employ. Perhaps, master Maseus will reward your unwavering loyalty, but from what I hear, he has a very short memory, so you better hurry.”
“May the Gods’ blessing be upon you, <brother/sister>,” says Athanasius, sliding into his new role.

dlgAnsw.text: “You wasted no time becoming the Second Acolyte.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “When you get a rare opportunity to reshuffle the deck, <master/mistress> <charname>, I’d suggest acting quickly and without hesitation.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So what’s going to happen to the Commercium now?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“It’s up to Strabos now. He can go after me, which would be a mistake, or he can try to keep what he has, which, under the circumstances, would be more prudent.
“The Temple oversees all trade in Ganezzar now. Amongst other things.”

“It was my idea, so it’s only fitting. Preaching and making speeches will only get you so far. You need a proper organization to oversee the matters of faith, uphold laws, set and collect levies, and so on. Who’s better qualified than me?”

dlgAnsw.text: “If I didn’t know better, I’d think you’re running the city now.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Like I said, who’s better qualified? Don’t worry, I haven’t forgotten what you did for me. I have plans for you, my <boy/girl>, plans that are bigger than this city, but first you must find that old temple Meru keeps talking about.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Why do you care about that temple?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Do I really have to explain the monetary and political value of a holy site? Find the temple, <charname>.”

“He needs me and he needs Varro. The Temple and the Inquisition, two pillars of Meru’s power. He still has that prophet but I have a feeling that we’ll get along fine. Faelan is a thorn in my side, but there’s nothing we can do about it at the moment.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So why do you care about that temple?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “He needs me and he needs Varro. The Temple and the Inquisition, two pillars of Meru’s power. He still has that prophet but I have a feeling that we’ll get along fine. Faelan was the only real threat but he’s gone now, thanks to you.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So why do you care about that temple?”
